questions.text: What is the approximate age of a person in whom the medial end of the clavicle is fused and also the sternum is completely fused:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

>25 Various ages of fusion are- The medial end of the clavicle – 21 to 25 years Manubrium fuses at old age (60-70) . Segments of Sternum fuses at 25 years of age. Xiphoid and sternum fuses at 40 years of age. Among the given options >25 years is the maximum age available.

Highyeild:

Important tables of ossification center, its appearance and fusion , are given below. Shoulder Ossification center Appearance Fusion Shoulder Joint 1 year Humeral Head 1 year Greater Tubercle 3 years 18 years Lesser Tubercle 5 years Coracoid process 10–11 years 16 years Acromion Process 14–16 years 17–18 years Medial End of Clavicle 18–20 years 21–22 years Elbow joint centers Appearance Fusion Capitulum 1 year 14–16 years Medial epicondyle 5–7 years 16 years Trochlea 9 years 14–16 years Lateral epicondyle 11 years 13 years Upper end of radius 5 year 14–16 years 0lecronon process of ulna 9 years 14–16 years Wrist joint centers Appearance Fusion Lower end of radius 2 years 18–19 years Lower end of ulna 5–6 years 17–18 years Capitate 2 months–1 year - Hamate 3 months Triquetral 3 years Lunate 4 years Trapezium 5 years Trapezoid 6 years Scaphoid 5 years Pisiform 10–12 years Base of 1st metacarpal At birth 15 years Pelvis ossification centers Appearance Fusion Ischio-Pubic Ramus 6th year Triradiate cartilage 13–15 years Ischial tuberosity 16 years 20–22 years Iliac crest 14 years 18–20 years Head of Femur 1 year 17–18 years Greater Trochanter 4 years 17–18 years Lesser Trochanter 12–14 years 17–18 years Other important centers Appearance Fusion Basi-sphenoid fuses with the Basi-occiput 18–20 years Calcaneum 5 th I. U. Month Talus 7 th I. U. Month Lower end of Femur 9 th I. U. Month 18–19 years Upper end of Tibia At birth 18–19 years Upper end of Fibula 4 years

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,Band C. are incorrect.

Solution:

Shotgun wound Image shows multiple entry wounds of pellets as seen in shotgun wounds .

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B.Tattooing -Partly burnt/unburnt gun powder particles.Around entry wound, they are adherent to the skin. It cannot be wiped away and felt as sharpones. This is called tattooing / stippling / peppering. Option C.Arsenic poisoning -chronic arsenic poisoning causes hyperkeratosis, Aldrich-mees line on nails. Option D.Graze wound / abrasion collar -is a narrow ring of stretched, abraded skin immediately surrounding projectile wounds, such as gunshot wounds.

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman was found dead at home. On examination she was brought to the mortuary by the police and the following findings were noted on examination. Which of the following is the likely cause of her death?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Strangulation by ligature Image shows Petechial hemorrhage,2 horizontal ligature marks on neck and Internal bruising of soft tissue , hemorrhagic area on neck autopsy with ? hyoid fracture suggests Strangulation by ligature .

Highyeild:

Hanging Strangulation Force of compression is body weight Outside force is applied Ligature mark is above the thyroid,is oblique,symmetrical and incomplete. Ligature mark is below thyroid,is horizontal,complete and continuous Knot present Knot absent Single ligature mark Multiple ligature mark ,Multiple hemorrhege, neck autopsy- Dry, white Hemorrhagic area Fracture of hyoid-Uncommon Fracture of hyoid-common. ( Most common in throttling ) Signs of struggle -absent Signs of struggle -present Lungs emphysematous bullae rare Emphysematous bullae common

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B.Hanging- will show single ligature mark and pale neck field on Option C.Throttling-will not show ligature mark, will show copper penny bruises on neck. Option D.Drowning - will show frothing from nose and mouth, cadaveric spasm.

Table:

#MANTRA Mechanical Asphyxia- Asphyxia : absence of pulse (literal meaning) . Exclusion of air from the lungs. Hypoxia : Deprivation of adequate oxygen supply at the tissue level, which is produced by asphyxia. Anoxia : Complete deprivation of oxygen at tissue level. Classification of violent asphyxial deaths- Hanging Complete hanging- no part of the body touching the ground. Partial /incomplete hanging- some part of the body touching the ground. Typical- knot at back of neck Atypical- knot anywhere other than back. Strangulation Ligature strangulation Throttling Bansdola Garrotting Mugging Suffocation Smothering Gagging Choking Crush asphyxia/ traumatic asphyxia Bansdola Burking Drowning Typical drowning (wet) Salt water Fresh water Atypical drowning Dry drowning - sustained laryngeal spasm Hydrocution- sudden cardiac arrest on entering water. Near secondary drowning- patient dies after rescue due to secondary complication of drowning .

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the Image:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Marbling Marbling is shown in the image. Image shows an irregular tortuous network of discolored veins . Reddish brown / greenish discolored veins Look like branches of a tree / marbled appearance . These are seen in the roots of limbs,abdomen and flanks . Marbling develops due to the delineation of the vasculature as a result of the reaction of hydrogen sulfide produced by bacteria with hemoglobin from the lysis of erythrocytes forming sulfa methemoglobin bluish green in color. It appears within 36 hours of death. It is well established by 36 to 48 hours.

Highyeild:

Decomposition/putrefaction: Colour changes: The earliest sign of decomposition is greenish discoloration of the body, seen first in the right iliac fossa externally and under the liver internally ( because in caecum , the contents are more liquid and are full of bacteria.) . In these areas, It appears in 12-18 hours, and slowly spread on whole body in 24-48 hr. greenish discoloration is due to formation of Sulph meth haemoglobin. Hb→ meth Hb→ +H2S→ Sulph meth haemoglobin. Later colour may change to purple, brown, bluish green or even almost black ( colour black is due to ferric sulphide.) The colouring matter (Hb) dissociates from the B.C. and the colour is taken up by the blood vessels, which are seen as prominent lines having purple, green or brown colour, especially on shoulders, axilla & Inguinal area. This change results in 24-48 hr , and is labelled as

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A. Postmortem lividity- It is purplish blue or purplish red discoloration seen under the skin in the most superficial layers of dermis, on dependent parts of the body after death due to capillo-venous distension. Option C. Filigree burns- is seen in lightning injury, do not lie along veins/nerves. Option D. Methemoglobinemia - the abnormal hemoglobin gives the blood a brown color. It also causes a bluish appearance of the skin, lips, and nails (cyanosis).

Table:

#MANTRA

questions.text: Which of the following is seen in fresh water drowning? Haemodilution Hypokalemia Hyponatremia Arrhythmia Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 3 and 4 Large amount of water moves from within the alveoli to pulmonary circulation→ This results in Hypervolemia → hemodilution→ hyponatremia → Sudden increased pumping capacity of heart→ Cardiac arrhythmia .

Highyeild:

Fresh water Drowning - Salinity of freshwater is 6 % NaCl. As the water enters the air passages and finally in alveoli → salinity is 0.6% Each of these alveoli is surrounded by an intense network of pulmonary vasculature carrying blood salinity of blood – 0.9 – 1% . Large amount of water moves from within the alveoli to pulmonary circulation→ This results in Hypervolemia→ Almost 3 – 3.5 litres fluid filled within 3 minutes → Sudden increased pumping capacity of heart → Cardiac arrhythmia → Ventricular tachycardia → Ventricular fibrillation . Because of hemodilution there will be swelling of cells which further results in lysis → Severe Hyperkalemia Hyponatremia Hypocalcemia Sea water Drowning- Salinity – 3.5% of NaCl The water enters the alveoli and the salinity is 3.5% NaCl Each of this alveoli is surrounded by intense network of pulmonary vasculature carrying blood, Salinity of blood→ 0.9-1.1% Large amount of fluid from pulmonary circulation enters the alveoli → Swelling of Alveoli → pulmonary Edema→ Asphyxia Each lung is about 3 kg Because of hemoconcentration , there is shrinking of cells → Hypokalemia → Hypernatremia Fatal period- Fresh water - 4 – 5 mins Sea water - 8 -10 mins

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Statement 2 . is Because , In Fresh water drowning→hemodilution there will be swelling of cells which further results in lysis → Severe Hyperkalemia. Therefore ,Option A,C and D. are incorrect.

Table:

#MANTRA Types of drowning- Wet drowning- primary drowning Dry drowning - 10-15%, laryngospasm , thick mucous→foam plug, panoramic views of past life, pleasant dreams without distress. Secondary drowning/post immersion syndromes /near drowning: Secondary drowning is death due to chemical or biological changes in the lungs after a near drowning incident : resuscitated an survives for 24 hours , +/- conscious, hypoxemia→ brain damage , electrolyte disturbances, pulmonary edema, hemoglobinuria, chemical pneumonitis Immersion syndrome / Cold water drowning : Cold water → Nerve endings ,strike epigastrium,entering ear drums, nasal passages. Horizontal entry (dive) → pressure on abdomen All these → Vagal inhibition → Cardiac arrest → death Mostly seen in suicide cases.

questions.text: You are a medical officer at a PHC, a 14-year-old girl presents to you after a sexual assault, and the girl refuses examination. How would you proceed in this case? Start treatment for STD and pregnancy Inform the police Record refusal of consent Take vaginal samples Start medical examination Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 2 and 3 are true As it’s a medico legal case , informing the police is compulsory.( Statement 2 ). Consent is necessary before physical examination. As the age is 14 years, the child’s consent is a must as per 89 IPC. The patient’s choice of not giving consent must be taken in written form in front of two witnesses. And the doctor must not forcefully do the examination (Statement 3,statement 4 and Statement 5). As refusal to treatment is not mentioned in the question, treatment to prevent pregnancy and STD can be given. (Statement1).

Highyeild:

Examination of proof of content of Rape - Written request Consent - If age > 18 years – consent of only Victim < 12 years – only guardian 12 – 18 years- victim + guardian. Female nurse should be present History -Victim should be encouraged to narrate the whole incident, questions should be avoided. Clothes- should be examined for stains, foreign body. Examination of body Examination of genitals- Vaginal examination of an adult female is done with a sterile speculum . Cervix, vaginal walls, and vault are inspected for redness, bruising, or tears. Two finger test is completel y abolished . Hymenal examination is done by Glastier – knee rods / bulbs Toluidine blue test - is sprayed on genitalia of victim for micro injuries . Any foreign body is preserved and sent to forensic science laboratory. Examination for venereal diseases Swabs and smear- If a woman reports within 96 hours (4 days) of sexual assault, all swabs based on the nature of assault are collected. Example , if the victim is certain that there was no anal intercourse, anal swabs need not be taken. Spermatozoa can be identified till 72 hrs (3 days) after assault . If she reports after 3 days, swabs for spermatozoa are useless. Take two swabs from the vaginal walls and posterior fornix. The nature of swabs and samples is determined by: Case history Time lapse between incident and examination Nature of assault If she has bathed/washed herself since the assault. Examination of Accused- Lugol’s Iodine Test : Glans penis cleaned by filter paper and then the filter paper is exposed to fumes of Lugol’s Iodine. We check if vaginal epithelial cells containing glycogen are present. Filter paper turns brown → Indicates penetration. This test is positive up-to 4th day after the act.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B,C,D are incorrect. Statement 4.and 5 are Because, Consent is necessary before physical examination and Sample collection.

Extraedge:

I.P.C. Section associated with consent S. 87 Person>18 yr of age can give consent for any surgery or procedure. S. 88 Nothing is an offence , done in good faith for the benefit of the patient with consent from the patient, even if complications happen. S. 89 Child<12 yr/ insane person, consent of a parent is a must. S. 90 Consent given by a child<12 yr,insane person or given under fear or fraud is invalid. S. 92 In an emergency, if it is impossible to obtain consent from a patient or relative of a patient, a surgery/procedure can be performed without consent. S. 53 Crpc 53(1).An arrested patient or accused can be examined by the doctor without consent of the person upon a written regulation by a police officer not below the ranking of a sub-inspector. 53(2). If this arrested person is a female, then the examination will be done by a lady RMP. 53(A). Procedure of a examination of accused of rape.

Table:

#MANTRA I.P.C. dealing with sexual offence S.357 (C) Hospital role for victims of sexual assault and acid attack--- first-aid for victims to be free of cost & if Hospital refuses ---punishable under 166 B IPC S.375 Definition of rape S.376 Punishment for rape S.376C Sexual intercourse by a person in authority. S.290 Frotteurism S.294 Exhibitionism S.297 Showing disrespect to dead body(1yr) S.376E repeat offender S.327(2) Enquiry/trial under sec 376 IPC will be done under camera. S.228-A revealing the identity of rape victim is crime. S.354 Indecent assault/ molestation S.354A sexual harassment S.354B Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe S.354C Voyeurism S.354D Stalking S.504 Word, Gesture or act to insult the modesty of a women CrPC53A rape accused examination (Consent not required) CrPC164 A rape victim examination (consent of victim must)

questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-4, B-3, C-1, D-2 Option A is the correct answer of matching weapon of injury with type of injury as explained below .

Table:

#MANTRA IPC dealing with Medico-legal Aspects Of Injuries S. 299 IPC Culpable Homicide not amounting to murder S.304 IPC Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder . life imprisonment (or) 10 years imprisonment & fine. S. 300 IPC Culpable Homicide amounting to murder S.302 IPC Punishment for murder Death penalty (or) life imprisonment + fine S.304 A IPC Rash (or) Negligent act causing death (such act should not be amounting to culpable homicide) 2 years (or) fine (or) both S.304 B IPC Dowry death Where death of a woman is caused by burns (or) any bodily injury (or) occurs under circumstances otherwise than normal. Within 7 years of marriage. If it is shown that she was subjected to cruelty / harassment before her death in connection with Dowry , by husband (or) any relative of husband. Imprisonment not less than 7 years (or) life Imprisonment + fine S.498 A IPC Cruelty / Harassment of woman by her husband / relative of husband. Imprisonment upto 3 years and fine S.306 IPC Abetment of suicide Imprisonment upto 10 years and fine. S.307 IPC Attempt to murder Imprisonment upto 10 years and fine. S.308 IPC Attempt to commit culpable homicide upto 10years Imprisonment upto 10 years and fine. S.309 IPC Attempt to suicide-Officially not abolished but Mental Health Care Act 2017 – has effectively decriminalized, since July 2018. S.44 IPC Defines Injury. S. 319 IPC Deals with HURT - Causing bodily pain, disease / infirmity (or) any pain - Simple injury is synonymously used for hurt. S.321 IPC Voluntarily causing HURT S. 323 IPC Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt Imprisonment for 1year (or) 1000 fine (or) both. S.320 IPC Deals with Grievous hurt 8 clauses in it. S.322 IPC Voluntarily causing grievous injury S.325 IPC Punishment for voluntarily causing Grievous hurt. Upto 7 years and fine. S.324 IPC Voluntarily causing hurt / simple injury by Dangerous weapon Also tells punishment upto 3 years or fine (or) both. S.326 IPC Voluntarily causing hurt / simple injury by dangerous weapon - Dangerous weapon – any weapon which is used for stabbing, cutting, shooting. - Dangerous means any instrument when used as a weapon of offence can cause injury to a person. Eg: iron rod Also tells punishment upto 10 years & fine S.326 A IPC voluntarily causing grievous hurt by the use of acid Punishment – not less than 10 years & fine. Fine includes all medical expenses and the fine collected is given to victim S.326 B IPC voluntarily throwing (or) an attempt to throw an acid. Imprisonment not less than 5 years S.332 IPC Deals with voluntarily causing hurt to prevent a public servant from performing his duties Punishment is 3 years (or) fine(or) both S.333 IPC Voluntarily causing grievous hurt to prevent him from performing his duty Imprisonment of 10 years.

questions.text: Match the following drugs with their antidote combination (Column – (A) with Column – (B): Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A-2, B-3, C-4, D-1 Option B is the correct answer of matching poisons with antidotes as explained below .

Highyeild:

Unfractionated heparin is acidic which is completely inhibited by protamine sulfate which is a basic drug. Ethylene glycol is converted into glycolaldehyde (causes neurotoxicity) in the presence of enzyme alcohol dehydrogenase which is inhibited by the drug named Excess of valproate leads to carnitine deficiency which results in increase in ammonia; levocarnitine assists in restoring carnitine stores , hence prevents valproate toxicity . Hydrofluoric acid causes hypokalemia and hypomagnesemia ; calcium gluconate can be used as an antidote of hydrofluoric acid.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A,C and D. are incorrect. Because the antidotes are not correctly matched.
